body.p: In doubles, the serving sequence ensures each player has fair opportunity to serve from both sides of the court.

ol.li: Once a team gains possession of the ball, the first serve is made by the player on the right. We'll call them "Server 1," and their partner "Server 2." In this case, Server 1 must serve to the opposing team's right court.
If the receiving team faults, the serving teammates switch places. Server 1 must now send the ball to the opposing team's left court.

Server 1 will continue to serve and switch places until their team faults. "Second serve" may be announced. The serving teammates do not switch sides, and Server 2 must send the ball into the service court diagonal from their current position.
Once Server 2 faults, the ball goes to the opposing team to serve. This is called a side-out. The sequence repeats from Step 1.
